intro: Chaenactis ramosa, commonly known as the branched mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, silver-gray foliage that helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pale yellow. Chaenactis ramosa is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
